name: Breaded, Fried, Softly Spiced Tofu
author: Miss Sriri
summary: This tofu recipe is completely gorgeous. A former roommate introduced me to some basics with tofu, and over the past few years, I've settled on this ratio of spices and other breading ingredients. The crust on the tofu sticks is tasty and the texture is really wonderful. Serve with a relish or a dip of some sort (I love this with plain yogurt mixed with eggplant brinjal). I usually make this with a cumin-scented rice dish and a garlicky broccoli side.
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package extra-firm tofu, drained and pressed
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
directions: Cut pressed tofu into 1/2-inch thick slices; then cut again into 1/2-inch wide sticks
Place tofu in a bowl, and pour broth over the top
In a separate bowl, stir together flour, yeast, salt, pepper, sage, and cayenne
Warm oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Remove tofu sticks from broth, and squeeze most (but not all) of the liquid from them
(You may have to roll sticks twice to end up with a fairly dry outer layer of breading
) Place tofu in hot oil; fry until crisp and browned on all sides
